content: During the first quarter of 2021, the government distributed over $400 billion in consumer stimulus contributing to Shoe Carnival’s growth of over 120% versus the prior year. Against last year's stimulus enhanced Q1, total sales were down 3.3% and comparable store sales declined 10.6%. Against last year's first quarter, our merchandise margin decreased 130 basis points and buying, distribution, and occupancy expense as a percentage of sales increased 280 basis points. With Q1 sales results in line and diluted EPS ahead of our expectations despite higher supply chain costs, we are reiterating our sales guidance for fiscal 2022 of 4% to 7% growth and raising our diluted EPS guidance to $3.95 to $4.15 from previous expectations of $3.80 to $4.10.
